style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Border X Brewing
breweries.description: We created Border X Brewing as a vehicle to explore new flavors in craft beer. With over 85 breweries in San Diego in January of 2013, we knew that we wanted to add our own unique contribution to the beer scene. Having been raised on both sides of the border, we always enjoyed eating from both cultures.  Mexican Street Tacos, chile enfused candies, enchiladas one day, and Hamburgers, mac and cheese and ding dongs the next. As adults we realized how unique being raised on the border was, how the mix of flavors was seeping from north to south, and south to north. It was this fusion in flavors that inspired to take traditional, European brewing traditions and infuse the process with a whole new palette of Latin American ingredients.  So we dug into our own roots for inspiration and found a treasure trove of brewing traditions, ingredients and unique flavors.  Our best example of this is our Blood Saison, an agave and Hibiscus infused Saison that come off sweet initially, middle tartness and finishing like a beer.

data.name: Amigo Warmer
data.description: Inspired by Theo’s Chili chocolate bar, this stout was dosed with chocolate, cinnamon, and Guajillo chili after fermentation. Sweet and chocolatey, with just a touch of warmth, it’s a welcome companion on a winter evening.

breweries.name: Hi-Fi Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The needle first dropped into the groove in 2009, when John and Ryan bumped into each other at the Craft Brewers Conference. They were members of the same homebrew club back home (the Mt. Si Brewing Society in Snoqualmie – no rules, no dues, just beer), but hadn’t realized that they shared a dream to “go pro.”

Upon his return from that conference, John started riffing on a business plan, and eventually turned up the volume to include his wife Cathy, Ryan, and fellow Mt. Si club member Joe.

After a few meetings, we found our resonant frequency as a group: an honest, straightforward approach to beer and to business.

The name Hi-Fi Brewing is a reflection of that approach. We maintain a high level of fidelity to our customers, our suppliers, our employees, and our beer.

data.name: Ballast Point Red Velvet Cake
data.description:
Impossibly reddish in color (due to the beets) with nitro cascade fading into a pink cap of stable foam, great clarity.  Seeing the beer in the glass shows the obvious resemblance to a slice of red velvet cake (red cake on the bottom topped with a layer of creamy white frosting).  But the similarities don’t end there.  The aroma is dominated by chocolate with earthy notes of beets and subtle wafts of roast coco.  The flavor is similar to the aroma but with faint roast and hop bitterness coming in at the end balance it out, not cloying or overly sweet.  The mouthfeel is medium and the finish is luxuriously smooth.  It’s dessert served in a pint glass!
Note: Serve in a straight sided pint glass for full appreciation of the nitro cascade when poured.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Ballast Point Brewing Company
breweries.description: Ballast Point Brewing Company is one of San Diego's Premiere Breweries. We started out modestly as Home Brew Mart in 1992. Our goal was to teach others how to brew quality handcrafted beer at home. In 1996 the brewery was installed by New World Brewing Systems in the space behind our retail store and production began in September. In May of 2005 we open our second brewery in Scripps Ranch.  We currently distribute five of our favorite beers, Yellowtail Pale Ale,  Calico Amber Ale , Big Eye I.P.A., Black Marlin Porter and Wahoo Wheat Beer to a thirsty San Diego.  Come to our brewery and we will gladly give you a tour and allow you to sample our newest selection of beers. Currently our beer is available in twelve ounce bottles to 15.5 gallon kegs. We also offer half gallon and gallon glass jugs to go. Kegs are available for rent to the public with a minimum deposit.  The name for our brewery comes from the point where Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo first set foot in California. Located on the Point Loma Peninsula, Ballast Point is considered the gateway to San Diego Harbor. Stones from this area were used as ballast in the cargo holds of sailing ships returning to the eastern seaboard. Many New England streets are still lined with the cobblestones brought back from San Diego.

breweries.name: Perennial Artisan Ales
breweries.description:
Our philosophy is to brew beer with the adventurous craft beer drinker in mind—focusing on hand-crafted, small batches of beer, using local, seasonal and organic ingredients as much as possible.

Our beers are influenced mostly by Belgian and American craft styles, but the addition of premium ingredients such as fruits, spices or wild yeast strains sometimes causes the beers to defy traditional categories. Our barrel aging program features a wide variety of beers aged in wine and spirits barrels, ranging from a Rye barrel-aged Mexican Chocolate Stout to a wild yeast-fermented Saison aged on Missouri wine grapes in French oak wine barrels. We strive to always achieve balance with each of our recipes, making our beers exceptional with food.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.description: Generous amounts of Roast and Chocolate Malt give this beer notes of dried fruit, chocolate, and caramel flavors. 40lbs of locally harvested Brewer's Honey make it seriously big. Winter is the perfect season for the big, creamy froth on top and warmth of this Big Brown Beer.

data.name: Big Chocolate Porter
data.description: Our Big Chocolate offers an innovative twist to the traditional porter. Chocolate and roasted Carafa malts provide a base of bittersweet chocolate and mocha. It is then dry nibbed with raw cocoa in the fermenter and finished with a touch of vanilla bean to create the perfect balance between bitter and sweet. This beer offers the taste of roasted coffee and cocoa with dry, smoky undertones.

breweries.name: Blowing Rock Brewery
breweries.description:
The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.

152 Sunset Drive
Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236
Telephone: 828-414-9600 
http://blowingrockbrewing.com/

breweries.name: Clown Shoes Beer
breweries.description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

breweries.name: Surly Brewing Company
breweries.description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

Our restaurant specializes in all natural beef which we dry age in house to produce a distinctly tender and flavorful steak. We have a wide range of flavors on our menu and feature nightly specials.

Our Chief Brewer produces all our draft beers in house, offering a wide variety of flavors to please every palate.

breweries.name: Oak Creek Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The Kraus family came to Sedona in 1993 with all their worldly goods and a dream, to brew great fresh beer the way Fred learned at the Gasthausbrauerei Hufeisen, or Horseshoe Brewery, in the picturesque village of Pottenstein, Germany. The dream became reality when they opened the doors of Oak Creek Brewing Co. in west Sedona.

Since February 1995 Sedona's only Microbrewery has been known to locals and tourists alike as the place to enjoy delicious handcrafted brews in a relaxed, unique setting.

data.name: Chocolate Ale with Raspberry
data.description: We’re always looking for playful new ways to approach the art of brewing, so we invited back celebrated chocolatier Christopher Elbow  to reimagine our very popular collaboration, Chocolate Ale. Elbow has earned a worldwide reputation for his ability to harmonize all kinds of flavors with chocolate. For this exciting new version has has paired the bright flavors and aromas of raspberry for a fresh take on an old favorite.

breweries.name: Nexus Brewery
breweries.description:
Nexus Brewery is dedicated on being the Albuquerque brewery that people can count on when it comes to providing amazing tasting beer and excellent food. We love good beer, and that makes our job just that much more fun. We sell delicious New Mexican soul food with a mix of southern comfort food. Come on down to Nexus Brewery and enjoy the beer we brew. We’d love to meet you and pour you a cold one.

You don't just drink a beer; you drink in the experience of life and all that goes with it.

Throw in the best beer in Albuquerque and it's an ExBeerience.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

breweries.description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer John Federal, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Gordon Biersch Brewing
breweries.description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

data.name: Chocolate Stout
data.description: This Irish style dry stout features dark roasted barley and oats to create a full mouth feel while raw cocoa powder is added with the hops to create an amazing bittersweet counterbalance.
data.foodPairings: Any of our CAB steaks, Espresso Burger

breweries.name: Main Street Brewing
breweries.description:
At 4204 Main Street Brewing Company we believe simple and amazing food and beer pairing is a staple in life and we wanted to share that. Our neighborhood restaurant and brewery is a place to meet, experience amazing food, carefully brewed local beer and to enjoy life. Whether you love food or you love beer you’ve come to the right place. We are here for the food and beer lovers just like us.
 
We have a unique atmosphere at Main Street and a menu that compliments our beers. From light and sweet to heavy and bitter, you can find a beer here that suits your taste. Come in and enjoy one of these locally crafted beers. Keep coming back to find out about our latest beers and menu items.
 
Our outside patio is dog friendly!

data.name: Chocolate Stout
data.description: Saddlebock chocolate stout has the lovely dark color and creamy mouth feel of our Stout – with the addition of delicious chocolate notes. The source of the chocolate flavor is organic cacao nibs, added during the brew process.

breweries.name: Saddlebock Brewery
breweries.description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.

data.name: Chocolate Weizenbock
data.description: This chocolate wheat bock is our fortified version of a Dunkel Weizen. It has a fruity ester fermentation character with some spiciness from the yeast, which balances the bolder malt character. It has a full body, low bitterness and low alcohol strength.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.name: Chocolatized
data.description: The darkest of Pisgah brews, the beer formerly known as Vortex II took a significant transformation when Pisgah brewers added a heavy dose (25lbs in 5bbls) of raw cocoa nibs to the brite tanks, thus creating what will now only be known as "Chocolatized". Congratulations to the brewers, as this Russian Imperial Stout aged on cocoa nibs brought home a coveted Gold Medal at the 2014 Great American Beer Festival for the Chocolate Beer Category.

data.name: Dark Persuasion Ale
data.description: Delicate dark chocolate with a whisper of coconut... You know you want it, go ahead and indulge. You can finally have German Chocolate Cake and drink it too. There's no need to be nervous, it's just wickedly deep and full of flavor and desire. With its provocative aroma and smooth body, this is certainly the darkest of fifty shades of risqué.

breweries.name: Icicle Brewing Company

We are a Production Brewery and Tasting Room located in Leavenworth, Washington. We produce fresh, delicious craft brews!

Our tasting room overlooks our craft brewery where our head brewer, Dean Priebe has masterfully combined the pristine waters of the Icicle River with only the freshest ingredients to craft fresh and flavorful ales and lagers for your enjoyment.

data.name: Dos Cocoas
data.description:
Side Project #4 “Dos Cocoas” Chocolate Porter is a little experiment with a traditional porter and two types of cocoa. I used cocoa powder in the whirlpool and then aged the beer for one month on a bed of cocoa nibs.

What you will get from this beer is fine chocolate aroma, a unique chocolate bitterness and a tantalizing balanced chocolate flavor from both the cocoa powder and nibs.

The original, 2008 version, was a collaboration project with Cocoa Atlanta, who supplied us with the cocoa for this experiment. The revived 2013 version uses cocoa shells and nibs from Olive and Sinclair Chocolate Company.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. breweries.name: Terrapin Beer Company
breweries.description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

data.name: Double Chocolate Stout
data.description: An American Style Stout that is brewed with chocolate malts, lactose and real chocolate. Full bodied and flavorful throughout, our Chocolate Stout is a unique take on a unique and often ignored style.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: Emily’s Choconut Porter
data.description: The Hollow Porter aged over Ecuadorian cocao nibs and roasted coconut. Pleasantly chocolaty and nutty without a cloying sweetness. These extra ingredients add a layer of flavor to the base beer without compromising or covering up the natural malt flavors.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Firefly Hollow Brewing
breweries.description: At Firefly Brewing, our mission is to express our collective pursuit of happiness through our shared passion for beer. We are a conglomerate of creative minds who believe we can make the world a better place by providing an atmosphere and a product conducive to creative expression. It is our sincerest hope that the beer we create helps you further your own creative journey and propels you down your own road to happiness. Our slogan, “Get Lit” is a testament to spreading our inspiration, because it takes more than one firefly to enlighten the world.

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

data.name: Hop Chocolate
data.description: When it comes to hops, late kettle additions are some of our favorites. We took a classic American Pale Ale and hopped it with Mosaic and Citra because of their blend of earthy, pine, tropical fruit and citrus qualities. We then aged this copper colored, medium-light bodied pale ale on cocoa nibs to impart chocolate and roasted notes with no impact on the color. This beer drinks like a certain bittersweet chocolate, almond and coconut candy bar that shall remain nameless!

breweries.name: Cortland Beer Company
breweries.description: Welcome to the Cortland Beer Company, the start of something new in Cortland, NY. We are located at 16 Court Street, in the heart of Downtown Cortland, NY. Our tasting room is open and we are selling growlers and kegs at this time. You may also call ahead and pre-order your growler to go. We will do our best to have it packaged and ready to pick-up when you stop in. Keep your eyes open in the next few months for Cortland Beer Company beers at your favorite local pub’s and restaurants, and ask them to put it on tap.

breweries.name: Surly Brewing Company
breweries.description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

breweries.name: Lake of Bays Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Lake of Bays Brewing Company is Northern Ontario's newest craft brewery. We busted our butts for more than a year getting ready to launch, and now our retail store and brewery in Baysville is open for business (woohoo!). Try our beer and see what Pure Northern Taste is all about. Cheers!

data.name: Mole Porter
data.description:
This is the first of our Second Shift series.  These are one-offs we are brewing, inspired by our surroundings and past experiences.  

This is our award winning chocolate porter with extra spices reminiscent of the oaxacan mole sauce.  We combines California, Pasella, and Chipotle CHILIES with CINNAMON, CLOVES, and COCOA nibs to create this ROBUST porter packed with flavor to warm you up this winter.
data.foodPairings: Parings include - Pork or beef tacos, stews and chilis, gruyere cheese, and chocolate desserts.

breweries.name: Second Self Beer Company
breweries.description: Second Self Beer Company is a brand new craft brewery in Atlanta, Georgia. We believe layers of character and flavor can be built to be greater than the sum of its parts. Our no compromise approach to both ingredients and techniques ensures a quality craft product for our consumers. No shortcuts. No extracts. Only the best for our beer and it shows in the flavor. We've worked to make sure our product is not only excellent to drink but is easily paired with food, making it a perfect choice for any occasion. We draw inspiration for our recipes from our experiences and surroundings. Currently Second Self is available on draft at local restaurants, bars and growler shops.

locations.name: Main Brewery
